availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Daniel (Johnson County, KY, farmer and private 65th Inf)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, soldier. Son of Isom Daniel. Married to Sarah Jayne Daniel in Johnson County on December 23, 1845. Father of Wyatt Daniel, Henry Daniel, Martha Daniel, Amanda Daniel, Perlina Daniel, Isom Daniel, and Emily Daniel. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as a private from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, pp. 118B-119A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 259.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 125A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, 1843-1875, Film #001912950, p. 128 of 239 of microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 895.
